title: Easy Morning Glory Muffins Recipe
description: These morning glory muffins are made with a combination of carrots, apple, raisins, coconut, walnuts, and cinnamon. A glorious way to start any day.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Bread Quick Bread Recipes Muffin Recipes Carrot Muffin Recipes Easy Morning Glory Muffins 4.8 (1,181) 924 Reviews 137 Photos These morning glory muffins are easy to make and a glorious way to start any day. They combine the great taste and chewy texture of carrots with the wonderful flavors of apple, raisins, coconut, walnuts, and cinnamon. By lilly26 Updated on March 9, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 137 137 137 137 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 cups all-purpose flour 1 ¼ cups white sugar 2 teaspoons baking soda 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon ¼ teaspoon salt 2 cups shredded carrots 1 apple - peeled, cored and shredded ½ cup raisins ½ cup chopped walnuts ½ cup unsweetened flaked coconut 3 large eggs 1 cup vegetable oil 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners. Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl; stir in carrots, apple, raisins, walnuts, and coconut. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat eggs, oil, and vanilla together in a separate bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir egg mixture into the carrot mixture until just moistened. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 20 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 1,720 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 421 Calories 25g Fat 45g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 421 % Daily Value * Total Fat 25g 33% Saturated Fat 6g 29% Cholesterol 47mg 16% Sodium 289mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 45g 16% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Total Sugars 23g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 1mg 2% Calcium 27mg 2% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 159mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Morning Glory Muffins 01 of 137 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 137 Photo by  Harriet Johnson 12/22/2024 Great flavors A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort These muffins are great! Will definitely make them again. 03 of 137 Photo by  EdgyPear4666 10/22/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Great flavors Crowd-pleaser I really enjoyed making these muffins. I think this recipe is a brilliant mix of healthy and delicious! I made a few changes to the original recipe: I used 1 cup of honey instead of 1 1/2 cups of sugar, which made them nicely sweet without being overpowering. I also swapped the freshly grated carrots for 2 cups of green vegetable pulp, which added a healthy twist. To spice things up, I added 1/4 teaspoon of ginger powder and 1/4 teaspoon of grated nutmeg.The mixed nuts—pecans, walnuts, almonds, and Brazilian nuts—added a delicious crunch. Overall, these muffins were easy to make and turned out amazing! I’ll definitely be making them again. 04 of 137 Photo by  CheekySage6886 10/06/2024 Original recipe is great. I want something a little healthier, so here is what I did. Reduced sugar to 1/2 cup (brown), eliminated the oil and replaced it with 1 1/4 cups of unsweetened apple sauce, used 4 eggs and 3 scoops of vanilla protein powder. Used 1 whole shredded Asian carrot (large one) and 1 and 3/4 shredded apples. Made 12 delicious extra large muffins. Oh and used pecans instead of walnuts and craisins instead of raisins. Came out perfect. Working on eliminating the sugar altogether 05 of 137 Photo by  ElfinWok4986 07/26/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Great flavors Family favorite I absolutely loved it and the flavor was incredible however, 1 cup of oil is too much for this recipe. It was so much that when I took the muffins out of the pan, there was pools of oil still left in the pan. Still so delicious tho. I read a comment that you could replace that cup of oil with a cup of applesauce and I’ll definitely be trying that next time. Or maybe even 1/2 cup oil and half cup almond milk. This recipe made me 16 beautifully large muffins. So good! 06 of 137 Photo by  Tetya 10/18/2023 They are great for my taste. My husband wasn't impressed. I didn't have nuts and made some changes. I used cranberries instead of raisins, coconut oil instead of vegetable. Added shredded honeynut squash. Baked 12 muffins and 6 mini pound cakes for about 25 min. 07 of 137 Photo by  TidyHash4878 05/01/2023 Instead of walnuts I used a handful of chopped pecans and instead of apple I used 1.5 tablespoons of applesauce. It was phenomenal.. and for the topping I made 1 cup of confectioners sugar with 2 tablespoons of real lemon juice from lemons. Great recipe. 08 of 137 Photo by  Lynette 02/10/2023 Was perfect as is 09 of 137 Photo by  MatureHoney1090 01/19/2023 These muffins were excellent! I make them often. I think next time I will cut the sugar to 3/4 cup and try 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. 10 of 137 Photo by  Penny 11/08/2022 Excellent recipe. Cut the sugar to 3/4 cup, cut the oil to 1/2 cup and added 1/2 cup of applesauce, cut walnut to half and topped up with unsalted sunflower seeds. Perfect breakfast muffins. Just my preferences, but awesome recipe to take off from! Thanks. 😊 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Sarah's Banana Bread Muffins 1,072 Ratings Bran Flax Muffins 613 Ratings Pumpkin Apple Streusel Muffins 1,231 Ratings Banana Muffins 5,115 Ratings Banana Crumb Muffins 14,709 Ratings Better Morning Glory Muffins 72 Ratings Best Ever Banana Bread 2,408 Ratings Health Nut Blueberry Muffins 878 Ratings Morning Glory Muffins I 1,043 Ratings Mocha Chocolate Chip Banana Muffins 739 Ratings Low-Fat Blueberry Bran Muffins 1,084 Ratings Carrot Pulp Muffins 8 Ratings Grandmother's Buttermilk Cornbread 7,543 Ratings Healthy Protein Morning Glory Muffins 3 Ratings Downeast Maine Pumpkin Bread 10,502 Ratings Pumpkin Muffins with Streusel Topping 434 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: lilly26
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line cups with paper liners.;Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt together in a large bowl; stir in carrots, apple, raisins, walnuts, and coconut. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Beat eggs, oil, and vanilla together in a separate bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir egg mixture into the carrot mixture until just moistened. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Spoon batter into the prepared muffin cups, filling each 2/3 full. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 20 minutes. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
